author: bridge-bot
content:
<MarekM25> The main question I have is: how do you feel about the ModExp EIP?

Long-term, the best approach is to follow Vitalik’s suggestion and replace ModExp with a Solidity contract version. However, in the short term, it might make sense to simply reprice it.

Do you generally agree with this?

author: bridge-bot
content: <sophiagold0> I think the best approach would be to reprice it along with opcode repricing and then remove it when EVMMAX is ready

author: bridge-bot
content: <MarekM25> I think repricing so many opcodes will be a much bigger effort than repricing just the most problematic precompile. There is a chance that we will include ModExp in Fusaka, but I don’t see bigger (all opcodes/precompiles) repricing for Fusaka. (re @sophiagold0: I think the best approach would be to reprice it along with opcode repricing and then remove it when EVMMAX is ready)

author: bridge-bot
content: <sophiagold0> Yeah I think this would mean doing it in Glamsterdam. My assumption is combining repricing would mean less splitting of focus

author: bridge-bot
content: <amezianehamlat> I agree with @MarekM25, I think there is some emergency to ship modexp in Fusaka because currently modexp  is the slowest execution (precompile) in most of the clients, if not all.

author: bridge-bot
content:
<rodiazet> Ideally we want to have evmmax shipped in Amsterdam. 
Some news about how Poseidon hash can work there can be found here https://github.com/ethereum/evmone/pull/1126 (re @sophiagold0: I think the best approach would be to reprice it along with opcode repricing and then remove it when EVMMAX is ready)
